required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics and Safety of ALA in Acne Vulgaris
clinical_study.official_title: A Pharmacokinetics and Safety Study of Aminolevulinic Acid Hydrochloride Topical Powder in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Facial Acne Vulgaris.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the pharmacokinetics and safety of ALA in patients with moderate and severe acne vulgaris after single dose in different dosages.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration [Cmax](after deduction of background)
Area Under the Curve [AUC](after deduction of background)
Apparent Volume of Distribution [Vd](after deduction of background)

primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment related adverse events as assessed by physical examination, vital signs, clinical laboratory values, local skin responses

intervention.description: prepare 5% ALA solution, apply topically to the affected area for 1.5 hours, single dose
prepare 10% ALA solution, apply topically to the affected area for 3 hours, single dose
